content: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language designed to be easy to read and write. It was created in the late 1980s by Guido van Rossum and has since become one of the most popular programming languages in the world, used for a variety of applications including web development, scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and more. It has a simple syntax, supports multiple programming paradigms, and has a large standard library and active community of developers.
